item.title: 香港建筑商新世界接近达成 110 亿美元贷款再融资协议
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，香港负债最多的建筑商之一新世界发展有限公司（New World Development Co.【原文：New World Development Co., one of Hong Kong’s most indebted builders, is close to securing a crucial HK$87.5 billion ($11.1 billion) loan refinancing deal, according to people familiar with the matter, the culmination of months of negotiations as it raced to secure a lifeline amid a deepening liquidity crisis.】

item.title: 英国未来 10 年将在基础设施领域投资 7,250 亿英镑
item.description: 作为英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）推动利用投资拉动经济增长并重新赢得选民支持的努力的一部分，英国政府概述了在未来 10 年内至少斥资 7,250 亿英镑（9,740 亿美元）建设该国岌岌可危的基础设施的计划。【原文：The UK government outlined plans to spend at least £725 billion ($974 billion) on the country’s creaking infrastructure over the next 10 years, as part of Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s push to use investment to lift economic growth and win back support from the electorate.】

item.title: 美联储等待时机确定谁来支付关税
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿的经济编辑。今天我们关注美联储不愿降息的问题。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at the Fed’s reluctance to cut rates. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 对美达推进人工智能的怀疑提高了招聘人才的成本
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，我们的每日时事通讯提供彭博社全球记者对科技商业的报道和分析。今天，莱利-格里芬（Riley Griffin）将报道 Meta Platform Inc.【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Riley Griffin reports on Meta Platform Inc.’s costly efforts to recruit talent for its artificial intelligence program.】

item.title: 英国央行将关键利率维持在 4.25% 的鸽派分歧投票中
item.description: 英国央行将利率维持在 4.25%，投票结果的分歧比预期的要大，决策者们在地缘政治紧张局势加剧的背景下权衡了英国就业市场疲软和经济增长乏力的问题。【原文：The Bank of England held interest rates at 4.25% in a more divided vote than expected as policymakers weighed up the UK’s softening jobs market and weak growth against a backdrop of mounting geopolitical tensions.】

item.title: 土耳其维持关键利率不变，表明抗击通胀的决心
item.description: 土耳其中央银行维持其关键利率不变，强调其在新的地缘政治风险中抑制通货膨胀的承诺。【原文：Turkey’s central bank kept its key interest rate unchanged, underscoring its commitment to quelling inflation amid new geopolitical risks.】

item.title: 瑞士官员引导经济应对特朗普关税风暴
item.description: 如果你想找一个例子来说明贸易战威胁所造成的动荡和意想不到的后果，不妨看看瑞士的案例。【原文：If you’re looking for an example of the turmoil and unintended consequences that trade war threats cause, consider the case of Switzerland.】

item.title: 泰国亿万富豪支持的顶级集团赢得数字银行许可
item.description: 据泰国中央银行称，以Charoen Pokphand Group、Gulf Development Pcl和SCB X Pcl为首的三家集团已获得泰国新的虚拟银行执照，以促进泰国银行业的竞争。【原文：Three groups led by Charoen Pokphand Group, Gulf Development Pcl and SCB X Pcl have clinched Thailand’s new virtual bank licenses to boost competition in the nation’s banking industry, according to the central bank.】

item.title: 浙江三花被指将扩大香港上市规模至 12 亿美元
item.description: 浙江三花智能控制股份有限公司（Zhejiang Sanhua Intelligent Controls Co.【原文：Zhejiang Sanhua Intelligent Controls Co. raised HK$9.3 billion ($1.2 billion) after expanding the size of its Hong Kong share sale and pricing the deal at the top of the marketed range, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 西班牙反对吕特将北约开支目标提高至 5%的计划
item.description: 据一位政府官员称，西班牙将反对北约将成员国国防开支目标提高到 5%的计划。【原文：Spain will oppose NATO plans to raise the target for members’ defense spending to 5%, according to a government official.】

item.title: 奢侈品供应商 MinervaHub 要求银行修改其债务条款
item.description: 时装和配饰材料供应商 MinervaHub SpA 公司正在与贷款人重新谈判债务条款，以应对奢侈品行业的衰退。【原文：MinervaHub SpA, a supplier of materials for fashion and accessories, is renegotiating debt terms with lenders as it battles a downturn in the luxury sector.】

item.title: 据说舒瓦将为价值 20 亿美元的鱼饲料部门 IPO 挑选银行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Schouw & Co.公司已选定银行帮助安排丹麦工业鱼饲料企业BioMar集团在哥本哈根的首次公开募股。【原文：Schouw & Co. has picked banks to help arrange a potential Copenhagen initial public offering of Danish industrial fish feed business BioMar Group, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 贝恩称奢侈品公司以更便宜的配饰应对经济放缓
item.description: 一份新的报告显示，奢侈品牌正在推出价格更低廉、体积更小巧的配饰，以增加店铺客流量，应对需求放缓。【原文：Luxury brands are putting out more affordable and smaller accessories as they seek to generate store traffic to counter slowing demand, a new report shows.】

item.title: 中东冲突导致石油价格飙升，印度卢比创三个月新低
item.description: 印度卢比跌至三个月来的最低水平，因为油价飙升凸显了印度易受能源冲击的脆弱性。【原文：The Indian rupee weakened to its lowest level in three months, as a surge in oil prices underscored the nation’s vulnerability to energy shocks.】

item.title: 全球石油价格飙升，卢布坚挺削弱俄罗斯石油收入
item.description: 由于货币升值，俄罗斯几乎无法从近期油价飙升中获益，这使得克里姆林宫的财政收入面临压力。【原文：Russia is barely benefiting from the recent surge in oil prices because of its strengthening currency, keeping the Kremlin’s revenue under pressure.】

item.title: 印度最大港口即将举债 35 亿美元
item.description: 这座将成为印度最大港口的建筑公司计划举债多达 3,000 亿卢比（35 亿美元），让贷款人有机会投资于印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）基础设施改革的基石之一。【原文：The firm building what will become the largest port in India plans to raise as much as 300 billion rupees ($3.5 billion) of debt, giving lenders an opportunity to invest in one of the cornerstones of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s infrastructure overhaul.】

item.title: 谷歌在与欧盟 41 亿欧元罚款的斗争中遭遇挫折
item.description: 欧盟最高法院的一位顾问称，监管机构对这家美国巨头滥用安卓系统市场力量的惩罚是正确的，这使谷歌抗击创纪录的 41 亿欧元（47 亿美元）欧盟反垄断罚款的斗争遭受了打击。【原文：Google’s fight against a record €4.1 billion ($4.7 billion) European Union antitrust fine suffered a blow after an adviser to the bloc’s top court said regulators were right to punish the US giant for abusing Android’s market power.】

item.title: 日本执政党在选举中承诺到 2040 年加薪 50
item.description: 日本执政党在下月举行的全国大选前公布其政纲时表示，其目标是确保到 2040 年工人工资累计增长 50%，经济总量扩大到 1 夸脱亿日元（约合 6.9 万亿美元）。【原文：Japan’s ruling party said it aims to ensure workers secure a cumulative 50% pay increase by 2040 with the economy expanding to a value of ¥1 quadrillion ($6.9 trillion) as it unveiled its platform ahead of a national election next month.】

item.title: 挪威意外下调关键利率，结束离群状态
item.description: 挪威中央银行出人意料地在大流行病后首次降低了借贷成本，并表示今年将有更多的降息措施。克朗下跌。【原文：Norway’s central bank surprised with its first post-pandemic reduction of borrowing costs and said more cuts are on the cards for this year. The krone slid.】

item.title: 俄罗斯官员就经济降温还是陷入危机争论不休
item.description: 弗拉基米尔-普京总统的高级经济官员在一个旗舰论坛的会议上就俄罗斯的经济状况公开争论，一位政府部长发出了迄今为止最严厉的警告，称俄罗斯可能正徘徊在衰退的边缘。【原文：President Vladimir Putin’s top economic officials openly argued over the state of Russia’s economy during a session at a flagship forum, with one government minister issuing his starkest warning yet that the country may be teetering on the edge of a recession.】

item.title: 吉莉安-泰特谈复杂衍生品与资本主义的第五阶段
item.description:

item.title: 吉莉安-泰特谈复杂衍生品与资本主义的第五阶段
item.description: 在全球金融危机之后，人们对设计复杂的衍生产品和其他金融工具花费了大量精力和脑力这一事实感到非常愤怒。这不仅被认为是一种浪费，复杂性还被认为是危机的核心，因此是坏事。但时隔多年，回过头来看，金融复杂性到底有多坏？从2025年的角度来看，情况又是怎样的？本期节目邀请到了《金融时报》的专栏作家吉莉安-泰特（Gillian Tett），她将与我们分享她的观点。【原文：After the GFC, there was a lot of angst over the fact that so much effort and brainpower went into designing complex derivatives, and other financial instruments. Not only was this seen as wasteful, the complexity was deemed to be the heart of the crisis, and therefore bad. But all these years later, looking back, how bad is financial complexity really? What do things look like from the perspective of 2025. On this episode we’re joined by Gillian Tett, a columnist at the Financial Times, and als】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德称更多地区贸易可抵消全球损失
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德说，扩大该地区的贸易有助于弥补全球分化造成的损失。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said greater trade in the region could help compensate for losses suffered as a result of global fragmentation.】

item.title: 瑞士央行推出隐形负利率以维持货币市场运行
item.description: 瑞士国家银行可能已将其利率降至零，但其惩罚银行持有超额准备金的方式意味着，如果贷款人将过多现金存放在中央银行，他们将面临负利率。【原文：The Swiss National Bank may have cut its interest rate to zero, but the way it penalizes banks’ excess reserve holdings means lenders will face negative rates if they park too much cash at the central bank.】

item.title: 瑞士联合银行将利率降至零以阻止法郎流入
item.description: 瑞士国家银行将利率降至零，试图阻止投资者推高瑞士法郎。【原文：The Swiss National Bank cut its interest rate to zero, seeking to deter investors from pushing up the franc.】

item.title: 洪灾造成 92 人死亡，南非宣布发生全国性灾难
item.description: 南非九个省中有四个省因洪水和大雪造成 90 多人死亡，道路和桥梁被毁，随后南非宣布全国性灾难。【原文：South Africa declared a national disaster after floods and snow killed more than 90 people and destroyed roads and bridges in four of the country’s nine provinces.】

item.title: CVC Capital 为 BAPE 派息寻求 4 亿美元贷款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，CVC Capital Partners Plc 正在与银行洽谈 4 亿美元的贷款事宜，用于向其共同拥有的服装公司 A Bathing Ape 的股东支付报酬。【原文：CVC Capital Partners Plc is in talks with banks for a $400 million loan to fund a payout to the shareholders of a clothing company, A Bathing Ape, which it co-owns, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 印度 IPO 市场将迎来繁忙一周，交易额达 17 亿美元
item.description: 印度的一级市场将迎来今年最繁忙的时期，至少有四家公司计划在下周通过首次公开募股筹集总额约 1,500 亿卢比（17 亿美元）的资金。【原文：India’s primary market is set for its busiest period this year, with at least four companies planning to raise a total of about 150 billion rupees ($1.7 billion) through initial public offerings next week.】

item.title: 菲律宾再次下调关键利率，通胀率仍低于目标值
item.description: 在通货膨胀率仍低于目标之后，菲律宾中央银行如外界普遍预期的那样，今年第二次将其关键利率下调了四分之一个百分点。【原文：The Philippine central bank lowered its key interest rate by a quarter point for the second time this year as widely expected, after inflation remained below target.】

item.title: JX 高级金属公司将削减铜产量并加强回收利用
item.description: 日本 JX Advanced Metals 公司发言人周四表示，该公司计划削减的精炼铜产量将达到数万吨，但拒绝透露更精确的数字。【原文：Planned cuts to refined copper production at JX Advanced Metals Corp. will run to the tens of thousands of tons, a spokesperson for the Japanese company said Thursday, declining to give a more precise number.】
